title: Orla Ní Fhinneadha
text:
Orla Ní Fhinneadha is an Irish <a href="singer">singer</a>, <a href="teacher">teacher</a>, <a href="television%20presenter">television presenter</a> and former <a href="child%20actor">child actor</a>. A <a href="gaeilgeoir">gaeilgeoir</a> she has been a <a href="weather%20presenter">weather presenter</a> and teacher on the <a href="Irish-language">Irish-language</a> <a href="television%20station">station</a> <a href="TG4">TG4</a>. She is an accomplished <a href="Sean-n%C3%B3s%20singing">Sean-nós</a> singer. She was one of the presenters of <a href="C%C3%BAla4%20ar%20Scoil">Cúla4 ar Scoil</a>, a television series broadcasting <a href="primary%20school">primary school</a> lessons to children who could not attend school due to <a href="COVID-19%20in%20Ireland">COVID</a> related lockdowns.
Background.
Ní Fhinneadha attended Scoil Náisiúnta Cholmcille in <a href="Tully%2C%20County%20Galway">Tully, County Galway</a>, and Coláiste Cholmcille in <a href="Inverin">Inverin</a>. She was a contestant in the County Galway section of the <a href="Rose%20of%20Tralee%20%28festival%29">Rose of Tralee</a> competition.
Career.
Ní Fhinneadha qualified as a teacher.
She presented the New Years' Eve countdown show "Fáilte 2022" with <a href="D%C3%A1ith%C3%AD%20%C3%93%20S%C3%A9">Dáithí Ó Sé</a>.
